videoSnippet.title: Just Push Pawns and Checkmate
videoSnippet.description:
Photos by Lennart Ootes
Evans Gambit tutorial by me here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CUQQ4dym5ZU

Have a great day :)

Firouzja, Alireza (2778) - Shankland, Sam (2720)
Saint Louis Rapid & Blitz (chess24.com) [15] 2022.08.29
A14 English, Neo-Catalan declined

1.c4 e6 2.g3 d5 3.Bg2 Nf6 4.Nf3 Be7 5.O-O O-O 6.d3 c5 7.cxd5 exd5 8.d4 Nc6 9.Nc3 Ne4 10.Be3 Nxc3 11.bxc3 c4 12.Qb1 g6 13.Ne5 Bd6 14.Bf4 Rb8 15.Qb5 Ne7 16.Bh6 a6 17.Qb2 Re8 18.e4 dxe4 19.Nxc4 Bc7 20.Rfe1 Be6 21.Na3 Nf5 22.Bd2 Nd6 23.Bf4 f5 24.d5 Bf7 25.c4 g5 26.Be5 Rxe5 27.Qxe5 Nxc4 28.Qxf5 Nxa3 29.Bxe4 Bg6 30.Qe6+ Kg7 31.Bxg6

00:00 Hello Everyone!
00:25 Game Starts!
01:55 Completely New Game!
09:58 It Was In This Position!
12:00 Standings!
13:00 Top Blitz Players!
13:57 Contributions!

The Saint Louis Rapid & Blitz is the 4th stage on the 2022 Grand Chess Tour, a series of five events with a total prize fund of $1.4 million. The 10-player event takes place from August 26-31 and has a $40,000 top prize.

The rapid is a single round-robin on the first 3 days with a time control of 25 minutes for all moves and a 10-second increment from move 1. The final 2 days are a blitz double round-robin, with 18 rounds of 5+2 blitz. Rapid games count double, with 2 points for a win and 1 for a draw. Official website: grandchesstour.org
